utterance.content: Ah, come on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle. All right, Omar. Talk to me.

utterance.speaker: OMAR LINCOLN
utterance.content: I heard them two fighting. I mean breezy had a Park Avenue on. "You're a liar! You're a thief! I'm sorry I ever met you! I want a divorce!" If I was him, I would've killed her to just to shut her up. I-- I mean... Don't even write that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can't believe we're taking Omar Lincoln at his word.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I'm taking the word of Dan Samuels, who confirms at 4:50 p.m. he was at his flower shop, pointing a .38 at Omar Lincoln, and that Omar ran north, which is in the opposite direction of the Westlakes' townhome.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but maybe he doubled back--

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Omar says that he overheard the Westlakes having a knockdown drag out. That she used the "D" word.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Damian told us that things were fine between them, and that the last thing that Vicky said to him was, "Have a good game."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They had a fight. Married people fight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, then why did Damian lie to us about it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he was afraid you'd, I don't know, suspect him of murder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe he was afraid that we'd figure out what the fight was about. These are Damian's credit card charges.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, we went over those. Uh, cigars, Scotch, box seats.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This is a different card. Took us a while to find it because Damian paid the bill from a pocket account and he kept it a secret from Vicky.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And, given the charges, I'm sure he was keeping other secrets. There's a florist, some jewelry store at the mall, and he rented a playroom at the Varick Club at least once a week.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What's in a playroom?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not much more than a bed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, I'm a member.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, why would Damian rent a bed when he had a nice, big townhouse?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There's got to be a reasonable explanation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, let's go see if we can find it.

utterance.speaker: CALLIE LANGSTON
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, welcome back. It's been a long time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, well, I've been, uh, working a lot. No time for play.

utterance.speaker: CALLIE LANGSTON
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We're actually here about another one of your members. Damian Westlake. Apparently, he would come here often, rent a playroom.

utterance.speaker: CALLIE LANGSTON
utterance.content: I should probably get my supervisor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Callie, it's okay, you can tell us. Was Damian meeting someone here?

utterance.speaker: CALLIE LANGSTON
utterance.content: Um.

utterance.speaker: CALLIE LANGSTON
utterance.content: We're not supposed to get involved with members. Especially married members. But Damian... we couldn't help it. We fell in love.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he tell you that he planned on leaving his wife?

utterance.speaker: CALLIE LANGSTON
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he tell you about the problems with the money?

utterance.speaker: CALLIE LANGSTON
utterance.content: N--no. Uh, Mrs. Westlake did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You spoke to Mrs. Westlake?

utterance.speaker: CALLIE LANGSTON
utterance.content: She came to the club Wednesday morning. She said that she had figured it out about Damian and me, and she wanted to warn me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: CALLIE LANGSTON
utterance.content: Mrs. Westlake said that she was going to leave Damian, and then he wouldn't have any money. She said he couldn't live without money, so he would find someone else. A woman who could support him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And did you tell Damian about the conversation you had with his wife?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did he say?

utterance.speaker: CALLIE LANGSTON
utterance.content: He said he loved me, and that nothing would keep us apart. Then I heard about Mrs. Westlake on the news.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you talk to Damian after you heard about his wife's murder?

utterance.speaker: CALLIE LANGSTON
utterance.content: Just once. He said we couldn't see each other for a while. Until things calmed down. He told me that he didn't do it. But then he said he knew if the cops asked me that I should say that we weren't together and that it could make him look bad. What am I supposed to think?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Callie's alibi checks out. She was at work on Wednesday until 7 p.m. Uniforms are bringing Damian in now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, maybe Damian is a cheater and a bum, and a bad husband...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That doesn't make him a killer. And you keep looking at me like I'm crazy for believing in him, but that's just because you don't know him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, neither do you. The Damian that you think you know doesn't exist. You made him up just like you made up Derek Storm, just like you made up Nikki Heat. He's a character in a story that you told yourself when you were a homesick fourteen-year-old little boy. And maybe it's time to let him go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You can watch from Observation. You don't want to be in there for this.

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: You know, people keep telling me I should hire a lawyer. I say I'm innocent. I-- I shouldn't need a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you're innocent, Mr. Westlake, why is it every time I turn over a rock in this case, some dirty secret of yours slithers out?

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: I didn't do this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's what you said to the cops in Puerto Rico, too. Isn't it funny how you keep finding yourself in the same situation, telling the same stories? I've got a story, too. You want to hear it? My story is about a handsome little prince who only ever wanted to live well. So, he killed his dad, the king, and he stole all of his gold, and he spent it and he spent it until it was all gone.

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: I didn't marry Vicky for her money. I loved her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about Callie? That's right, Damian. We talked to her. She said that you were in love with her, and that you told her that you wanted the two of you to be together. Vicky was leaving you. Soon, you'd be free to have your happily ever after. But there's just one problem: once again, you were out of gold. Vicky stood between you and a fortune. We know what happens to people when they do that. You were the last one to see her alive. You were the only one with motive.

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: But I didn't kill her!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Damian Westlake, you're under arrest for the murder--

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: You're making a mistake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: --of Victoria Westlake. You have the right--

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: Look, I didn't do this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: --to remain silent. You have the right to an attorney .

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis up and gone already?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. She wanted to window shop before her violin lesson. It's her first Valentine's Day with Ashley and she's feeling the pressure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, yes. She wants a gift that says, "I love you," but nothing that says, "I love you more than life itself. Please don't leave me or I may die."

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, that's why you guys go for the chocolates and the flowers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wish the choice I had to make today was so simple. I realize I have the choice to believe in two terrible things. Either Damian is a killer, or Beckett's arrested an innocent man. Just thinking about it's making my head hurt.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, then forget your head. Listen to your heart.

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: Ricky.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I keep thinking back to when I was a senior. You were off at Harvard. You'd send me pages you were working on for your novel. And they were good, Damian. And you had talent. Why'd you throw it away?

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: Nah, you were the writer, Ricky. Not me. I didn't have anything to say. After I inherited all that money, I just didn't even want to try anymore. But when I look back at my life, I hope you won't mind if I list you as one of my few accomplishments.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You should've told me about Callie.

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: I swear to you, I didn't kill my wife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Can you think of anything we might've overlooked, anything that might speak to your innocence?

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: I slept in. I went to the gym. I had lunch in a cafe on the West Side. When I got home, Vicky was already there. She had been to see Callie. We fought. God, for hours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She said she wanted a divorce.

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: Yeah, she-- she showed me an envelope, said there were papers inside that our lawyer had drawn up for her to sign. She was gonna end the marriage. I begged her to reconsider. And she asked me to leave. She needed to think.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said Vicky showed you an envelope? What'd it look like?

utterance.speaker: BLANCA
utterance.content: I gotta get back to my route.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just five minutes, I promise. Ah, hello, hello.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Everyone, this is Blanca.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hola. Que estás haciendo aquí?

utterance.speaker: BLANCA
utterance.content: Está loco.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ah, lo siento. Bueno suerte.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I don't-- I don't know what-- So, first of all, you were right. Damian and Vicky did have a fight the night she died, and she did tell him she wanted a divorce. As a matter of fact, she showed him a large manila envelope full of papers from her lawyer that she was going to sign.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: An envelope with legal papers? There wasn't anything about this in the CSU report.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. Blanca, please tell them what happened to it.

utterance.speaker: BLANCA
utterance.content: Then I can go back to my route?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, of course.

utterance.speaker: BLANCA
utterance.content: I was delivering the mail Wednesday afternoon. As I made my way up 69 towards Park, I passed by Westlake and Mr. Utley. I said hello, they said hello back. A couple of minutes later, I get to the Westlakes' residence, the door opens, and Mrs. Westlake comes running out and hands me a large manila envelope. She said she wanted to make sure it went out in that day's mail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. So, you're positive that you saw Mrs. Westlake after you saw Damian?

utterance.speaker: BLANCA
utterance.content: Lady, I couldn't be more sure. Anything else?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, that's it. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BLANCA
utterance.content: Then I'm leaving now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course. Thank you, Blanca.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, Vicky was alive after Damian left the house.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And he was with Charles Utley until they came back and found her dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Damian couldn't have killed her.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Got it. D.A.'s office just kicked Damian Westlake loose, and they weren't too happy about it either.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, if Westlake didn't kill his wife, then he hired someone else to do it for him, just like he did the last time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wasn't it you that said that bad guys always bring their own weapons?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not when they're trying to make it look like a push-in robbery gone wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about the dog that didn't bark?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He got the dog used to the guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on. You just can't get over the fact that Damian was a person of interest in his father's murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I won't ignore the fact that there is a pattern here. People close to this guy seem to die violently.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or maybe somebody is using Damian's tragic past to frame him for Vicky's murder. Now, there's another suspect right in front of you that you're not even looking at. Someone who had motive, means, and opportunity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that would be whom, exactly?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Simon Campbell, Vicky's ex-husband. Think about it. Abandoned, cuckolded Simon. Do we really know this guy? Do we have any idea what he's capable of?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Well, do we?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All the evidence points to Damian.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but wouldn't that evidence be less conclusive if Damian didn't have this old murder hanging over his head? Or, better yet, if there was proof that Phillip Westlake was killed by a random intruder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, there isn't any proof.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not yet, there isn't. Since you can't see through the cloud of suspicion surrounding Damian, I'm gonna clear the air. I'm gonna solve Phillip Westlake's murder, prove my friend didn't do it. Meanwhile, you can check out Simon Campbell.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I need to go to the D.A. with something solid. Can you prove Westlake hired somebody to off his wife?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I just need a couple of days.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, what's our next move? If Damian hired someone to kill Vicky, then there's a money trail. I'll find it. Meanwhile, you guys look into Simon Campbell.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I'm sure he'll love it. Darling! You're daughter's a genius.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I knew that already.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: For Valentine's Day, she bought Ashley a frame, had it engraved "True Love," and put in a picture of his pet rat, Theodore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Heartfelt, yet humorous. Genius.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What's in the box?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is Phillip Westlake's murder file. I told Beckett I'm gonna solve the case.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, Richard.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? You're the one who told me to follow my heart.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes, but you know what I--

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, that case is older than me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This doesn't sound like encouragement.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Then...would you like some help?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, I would.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To hire a gunman, you need cash. And according to every that we've been through here, Damian didn't have any.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, well, it's somewhere. We just haven't found it yet.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All the expensive knickknacks in the house, maybe he pawned a figurine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Vicky was a designer. She was meticulous. She would've noticed if something went missing, like the engagement ring.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Got something?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Omar Lincoln overheard Vicky call Damian a thief, and when Vicky apologized to Morris Hasberg for accusing him of stealing her engagement ring, she cried. Maybe she wasn't crying because of Morris. Maybe she was crying because she realized that her husband was stealing from her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: CSU said the ring was accounted for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Vicky's credit card, wasn't there an appraiser on it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think I know how Damian got his money.

utterance.speaker: WALLACE BENNER
utterance.content: It was terrible what happened to Mrs. Westlake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She came to see you Tuesday afternoon.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What for?

utterance.speaker: WALLACE BENNER
utterance.content: Well, she wanted her jewelry appraised. I'm afraid I had some bad news for her. The stones were imitation, and I see that quite a bit. People need cash in a hurry, but they don't want to give up their jewelry, so they sell the diamonds and they replace them with high quality silicon carbide.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was one of the pieces an eleven karat engagement ring?

utterance.speaker: WALLACE BENNER
utterance.content: Yes. The entire basket setting had been replaced. She said that's how she knew something was wrong.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This whole case file is just one long loop leading back to Damian.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Apparently, neighbors saw someone loitering outside the Westlake home the night of the murder. Here's a sketch. What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis, I know this guy.

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can we talk for a moment?

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: Have you come to apologize?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: At least you're honest. What can I do for you, Detective?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You could show me the diamonds that you stole from Vicky. I spoke to Wallace Benner, the jeweler on the West Side. He said that he replaced your wife's diamonds with imitation ones. Over a period of several weeks, he exchanged twenty-six diamonds worth over eight million dollars, and gave you the real ones.

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: But doesn't this argue against your theory? That I killed my wife? If I have eight million dollars, why wouldn't I just leave? Be with Callie?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Greed. You used the first diamond as a down payment for the contract to kill her. Once Vicky was dead, you'd inherit and double your take.

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: You really think I'm that cold?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Personally, I have no doubt. But Richard Castle believes in you, and I believe in him. So, show me those diamonds. Show me that none of them are missing, or I will haul your ass back to jail.

utterance.speaker: DAMIAN WESTLAKE
utterance.content: I only changed the diamonds I had given her. Those pieces cost me millions of dollars, and I knew she'd have no particular attachment to them once we were over. I've led a careless and wasteful life, Detective. But I'm no killer. Twenty-six diamonds, they're all there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Detective Salazar? I'm Richard Castle. Thank you very much for meeting me.

utterance.speaker: RAY SALAZAR
utterance.content: I'm retired now, so you can call me Ray.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. So, Ray, what kind of man leaves beautiful Puerto Rico to retire in freezing cold New York?

utterance.speaker: RAY SALAZAR
utterance.content: The kind of man whose beautiful wife is from Long Island.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Understood.

utterance.speaker: RAY SALAZAR
utterance.content: So, you said on the phone this was about the Phillip Westlake case?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's right.

utterance.speaker: RAY SALAZAR
utterance.content: I really hated leaving the job with that one still unsolved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe I can help with that. Did you ever manage to identify the man that neighbors saw outside the Westlake home the night of the murder?

utterance.speaker: RAY SALAZAR
utterance.content: Thought we did. He looked a lot like a local tough named Enrique Molina, but when we brought Molina in, the neighbors couldn't pick him out of a lineup.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's because it wasn't Molina.

utterance.speaker: RAY SALAZAR
utterance.content: I'm listening.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Michael Rutherford was a scholarship kid at Edgewick Academy where Damian Westlake and I went to school. He was smart, but a sociopath, a thief. The kid barely graduated.

utterance.speaker: RAY SALAZAR
utterance.content: Were Rutherford and Westlake friends?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. As a matter of fact, it was Damian who turned him in to the headmaster for stealing. But they did run in some of the same circles, sometimes went to the same parties. What if Michael Rutherford heard about the Westlake vacation home in Puerto Rico? It was nearly always vacant, full of treasure. He could've made a small fortune and gotten revenge on Damian at the same time.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, how'd it go?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Damian Westlake is a thief and a cheater, but he might not be our killer. You guys, I hate admitting it, but Castle might be right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We've also been thinking that Castle might be right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Info's back on Simon Campbell. Vicky's ex-husband is what they like to call overextended.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Campbell's real estate firm took a big hit two years ago and he borrowed heavily to cover cost. Man needs a cash transfusion stat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is Simon in Vicky's will?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He gets the deed to the brownstone, which is worth over five million. He's also the executor of their children's estate.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Now, he was at home with the kids at the time of the murder. But he was on the second floor and they were on the third.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, he could've snuck out and been back before anyone noticed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which brings us to the Campbell brownstone and its very sophisticated security system. It records every door opening, every window.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: My friend in the ADA got us a warrant and we talked to the alarm company. At 4:37 p.m. on Wednesday, the front door opens. 5:42, it opened again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means someone left before the murder, and then returned after. You know, I'd like to talk to our Mr. Simon Campbell.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we called his place. He's out all evening on personal business and he's not picking up his cell phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mm-kay. Sit on his house. When he gets back home, bring him in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, what did you decide about Lanie and Valentine's Day?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh. I'm gonna play it safe and show up with a gift.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I found this little jewelry store that sells stuff, you know, that girlfriends like. Necklaces, charm bracelets. What about you? What are you gonna do?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, Jenny loves chocolate.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Jenny's planning her wedding. Your girl's on a diet and you're gonna give her chocolate?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey. It's Simon.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, he's got a little Valentine of his own, doesn't he? Is that Amber Patinelli, Vicky Westlake's employee?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You sure it's her? So much for Simon saying that he wanted to reconcile with Vicky.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you want us to do? Thought so. Let's bring them both in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was hoping you'd still be here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was just about to call you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I appreciate you coming in.

utterance.speaker: SIMON CAMPBELL
